summary: AI Video Generator SaaS (GrokVid.ai) with public marketing site + authenticated app for prompt-to-video creation, library management (download/delete), editing, and billing/credits.
architectural_notes: Product name: GrokVid.ai (AI Video Generator SaaS).
SaaS structure: public pages + authenticated app pages (/dashboard, /create, /library, /editor, /billing, /settings).
Core flow: prompt -> generate video -> edit -> download.
Library must support video status (processing/ready) and actions (download/delete).
Billing model uses credits and tiered plans (Free/Creator/Pro), with watermark/resolution differences.
Payments planned via Stripe (global) + Razorpay (India) with webhooks to refill credits.
AI pipeline is asynchronous and should use a queue system for jobs (e.g., BullMQ/Redis or SQS equivalent).
Planned services: text->video (Runway/Pika/SVD), text->image (Stable Diffusion), voice (ElevenLabs), lipsync (Wav2Lip), LLM prompt enhancement.

Internet Computer stack constraint: avoid external LLM API calls for emotion detection; implement deterministic rules-based classifier on frontend (TypeScript) and send emotion-annotated scene objects to backend.
known_issues: Automated build/deploy failed in conversation ("AI couldn't complete your request"); may require simplification/retry.

existing_features.title: Implement a deterministic, rules-based emotion classifier in the frontend that outputs the strict schema: emotion (fear|joy|calm|sadness|anger|surprise|wonder), intensity (0.0–1.0), energy (low|medium|high), and mood (dark|neutral|bright), derived solely from the user’s scene text (no external LLM/API calls).

Integrate the rules-based emotion classifier into the Create flow by replacing the current backend emotion-timeline generation call in the preview pipeline with a frontend-generated emotion timeline suitable for driving the virtual actor facial animation.

Use the detected emotion outputs (emotion, intensity, energy, mood) to bias scene timing and generation parameters in the Create pipeline: apply an emotion duration multiplier to computed durations, and use energy/mood to influence music/narration and/or scene rendering parameters in a deterministic way.

Persist the rules-based emotion analysis as part of the saved scene configuration JSON payload stored via addSceneConfig, alongside the existing gestures/emotions fields, so the backend receives the final emotion-annotated scene object data.
